Use when working with SurrealDB databases, implementing graph traversal, semantic search with embeddings, or building RAG applications.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing no executable code. All files are Markdown guides showing standard database operations using the official SurrealDB Python SDK. No network calls, file system access, or code execution capabilities are present beyond example code demonstrating legitimate database operations.

content.value_statement: Building applications with SurrealDB requires understanding its multi-model capabilities including graph relationships, vector embeddings, and real-time subscriptions. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for using the Python SDK to implement CRUD operations, semantic search, and graph traversal patterns.
actual_capabilities: Connect to SurrealDB with authentication and namespace selection
Perform CRUD operations using create, select, update, merge, patch, upsert, and delete
Create and traverse graph relationships using RELATE statement and arrow syntax
Implement vector similarity search with KNN queries and embedding storage
Subscribe to live data changes for real-time application updates
Build RAG applications combining vector search with graph relationships
limitations: Does not include SurrealDB server installation or administration
Requires separate setup of embedding models for vector operations
No built-in migration or schema versioning tools
Real-time subscriptions require persistent connection management

best_practices: Use context managers (async with) for automatic connection cleanup and proper resource management.
Parameterize queries with named parameters ($variable) to prevent injection attacks.
Add timeouts to recursive graph queries and create indexes on frequently accessed fields for performance.
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding credentials in source code; use environment variables instead.
Do not skip schema definitions when data integrity is important; use SCHEMAFULL tables.
Avoid unlimited recursive traversal without depth limits or timeouts, which can cause performance issues.

faq.question: What Python version is required?
faq.answer: SurrealDB Python SDK requires Python 3.8 or higher with asyncio support for async operations.

faq.question: What embedding models work with SurrealDB?
faq.answer: Any embedding model can be used including Sentence Transformers, OpenAI embeddings, and HuggingFace models. Vectors are stored as arrays.

faq.question: How do I integrate with LangChain?
faq.answer: Use SurrealDBStore from langchain_community.vectorstores for direct LangChain integration with similarity search.

faq.question: Is my data safe with vector search?
faq.answer: Vectors are stored in your SurrealDB database. No data is sent to external services unless you use cloud embedding APIs.

faq.question: Why are my queries slow?
faq.answer: Add indexes on vector fields and frequently queried metadata. Use appropriate K values and add timeouts to complex queries.

faq.question: How does this compare to Neo4j?
faq.answer: SurrealDB combines document, graph, and vector storage in one database, simplifying architecture for AI applications.
